required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparisons of Two Types of Armeo Robot for Upper Extremities
clinical_study.official_title: Comparing of Effects of Upper Extremity Rehabilitation on Upper Extremity Rehabilitation Robot Therapy Using Armeo Power and Armeo Spring - Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of two types of robot (Armeo power vs Armeo spring) for upper extremity rehabilitation on upper extremity function

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare two types of robot. The robot used in this experiment was Armeo power and Armeo spring. Armeo power could provide assistive force via motor, on the other hand, Armeo spring could not provide any assist.
Thus the results from this study might suggest usefulness of motorized robot.

study_design_info.masking_description: Outcome assessor does not know the allocation of participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Wolf motor function test
primary_outcome.description: Change of Wolf motor function test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 4 weeks after baseline, 8 weeks after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Curvature of the magnetic sensor trajectory (Kinematics of upper extremity)during reaching task

arm_group.description: Armeo power robot for upper extremity
Armeo spring robot for upper extremity

intervention.description: Intervention with Armeo power rehabilitation robot for upper extremity (made by Hocoma), which provide assistive force. The intervention was done 4 weeks, 5 times/week, 30 minutes/day.

Intervention with Armeo spring rehabilitation robot for upper extremity (made by Hocoma), which is operated only by participants, without any assistive force from robot. The intervention was done 4 weeks, 5 times/week, 30 minutes/day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hemiplegic patients secondary to first cerebrovascular accidents
- Onset ≥ 3 months
- 26 ≤ Fugl-Meyer Assessment score ≤ 50
- 3 ≤ Shoulder or elbow MRC scale ≤ 4
- Shoulder or elbow flexor spasticity modified ashworth scale ≤ 1+
- Cognitively intact enough to understand and follow the instructions from the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of surgery of affected upper limb
- Fracture of affected upper limb
